title: Sri Lanka has enough fuel; difficulty in distribution – Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka does not have fuel shortage, but a problem with distribution, newly appointed Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara told parliament on Wednesday (20).
The minister responded to former prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe’s address in which he said there is a fuel shortage in the country.

“We have petrol for 10 days, diesel for 14 days. There is a ship coming today and there is another ship coming tomorrow. We are unloading jet fuel this evening. We have also allocated diesel for the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB). But there is problem in distribution,” said Wijesekara.

The fuel shortage issue was raised when parliament debated the death of a protester in Sri Lanka’s central town of Rambukkana. The clash between the police and protesters also saw 24 people injured including eight police. (Colombo/April 20/2022)
